page.title: 04ASHBROOK HOUSE, CLYRO
page.content: {Ashbrook House}is a large residential accomodation in the centre of the village of Clyro. On a wall ofthe house is a plaque in memory of the well known Victorian Diarist, the {Rev. Francis Kilvert, }who lodged at this house from{1865 to 1872.} {Francis Kilvert}was born in 1840. He was the first son of six children. After being educated at{Oxford}he moved to Clyro. Here he wrote his famous {Diaries}and served as curate in the local church,{St. Michael and {All Angels.} He was curate to the{Rev. {R.L.Venables.}He had been curate in Clyro for four years when he began his Diaries. The Diaries give a very clear picture of country life at the time. He highlights local personalities, national events and general pace of life in the Victorian Parish of Clyro.
